verified: Tested across 3 save files on PC 1.6.15

parsnip.proTip: Plant on Day 1 of Spring Year 1. Harvest on Day 5, immediately replant. You can hit Farming Level 2 before the Egg Festival if you plant 15+ Parsnips.
parsnip.strategyNote: Parsnips have the fastest turnover in Spring (4 days). Raw shipping beats Keg processing here—Juice only adds 43g but ties up your Keg for 4 days. Save Kegs for high-value fruits.
parsnip.bestUse: Quick XP farming and early-game gold

green-bean.proTip: Plant by Spring 1 to get 7 harvests before season end. One of only two regrowth crops in Spring (the other is Coffee).
green-bean.strategyNote: 10-day initial growth is painful, but the 3-day regrowth makes it worthwhile. By late Spring, you're pulling 40g every 3 days per plant. Trellis crop—plan your pathing.

cauliflower.proTip: Plant in a 3x3 grid with Deluxe Speed-Gro for a chance at Giant Crops. Giant Cauliflower yields 15-21 crops instead of 9.
cauliflower.strategyNote: At 175g base, Cauliflower is Spring's most valuable single-harvest crop. The 12-day growth means only 2 harvests per season without Speed-Gro. Prioritize Pickles (400g) over Juice (393g)—faster processing.
cauliflower.bestUse: Giant Crop farming, max profit per tile

potato.proTip: 25% chance for extra potato per harvest. With Tiller profession, expected value per harvest is ~110g. Best early-game gold-to-effort ratio.
potato.strategyNote: 6-day growth, multiple harvests per season, bonus drops. Potatoes are the workhorse crop of Spring Year 1. Skip processing—your Kegs should be on Starfruit.
potato.bestUse: Reliable Spring income with bonus harvest chance

kale.proTip: 6-day growth = 4 harvests in Spring. Slightly worse gold/day than Potato but more consistent (no RNG). Good if you hate surprises.
kale.strategyNote: 110g base price is solid. Juice at 247g takes 4 days in Keg—that's only 34g/day extra over raw. Not worth the Keg time unless you're drowning in Kegs.

garlic.proTip: Unlocks Year 2 at Pierre's. Fast 4-day growth like Parsnip but 60g vs 35g. The Year 2 Spring meta pick.
garlic.strategyNote: If you're in Year 2+, Garlic outpaces Parsnip in every way. Same growth time, 71% more profit. Process into Pickles (170g) only if you have spare Jars.

rhubarb.proTip: Seeds only at Oasis (100g). Plant Day 1 of Spring for exactly 2 harvests. The highest Wine value in Spring.
rhubarb.strategyNote: Rhubarb Wine sells for 660g base, 924g with Artisan. That's competitive with Ancient Fruit Wine. The catch: 13-day growth and desert-only seeds. For min-maxers who plan ahead.
rhubarb.bestUse: Keg processing for maximum Spring profit

strawberry.proTip: Buy seeds at Egg Festival (Day 13). Plant immediately for 2 harvests. Save 1 fruit for Seed Maker → Year 2 full season of Strawberries.
strawberry.strategyNote: Strawberry is Spring's best regrowth crop at 120g per fruit. Wine (360g) is excellent. The meta play: buy 100+ seeds at Egg Festival, plant Day 13, get 2 harvests, seed-make for Year 2.

coffee-bean.proTip: Each harvest yields 4 beans. Replant extras for exponential growth. By Summer you can have 500+ Coffee plants from 1 starter bean.
coffee-bean.strategyNote: Coffee's 15g sell price is deceptive. The real value: brew into Coffee (150g) in Keg, or Triple Shot Espresso buff (+1 Speed). Speed buff is broken for mining and fishing. Keep a Coffee farm running all year.
coffee-bean.bestUse: Triple Shot Espresso production, exponential farming

blueberry.proTip: Yields 3 berries per harvest average. At 80g × 3 = 240g per harvest, then 4-day regrowth. Plant Day 1 for 5 harvests.
blueberry.strategyNote: Blueberry is Summer's gold standard for raw shipping. 240g every 4 days with minimal effort. Wine (210g per berry × 3 = 630g) takes 21 days of Keg time—only worthwhile if you have excess Kegs.
blueberry.bestUse: Mass planting for raw shipping profit

melon.proTip: Giant Crop candidate. Plant 3x3 grids with Deluxe Speed-Gro. Giant Melon = 15-21 melons from 9 seeds.
melon.strategyNote: 250g base makes Melon Summer's highest single-harvest crop. Wine (750g) is excellent. If you're not hunting Giants, alternate with Blueberries for consistent income while Melons grow.

starfruit.proTip: Seeds at Oasis (400g) or Casino. In my Year 3 greenhouse, Starfruit Wine with Artisan hits 3,150g per bottle.
starfruit.strategyNote: 13-day growth, 750g base. Raw ROI is 57.69g/day. But Wine (2,250g base, 3,150g Artisan) is where Starfruit shines. After testing: Starfruit→Wine→Cask→Iridium Wine (6,300g) is the proven endgame path.

ancient-fruit.proTip: Get seeds from Artifact Spots, Seed Maker, or Traveling Cart. In my save, one Greenhouse plant yielded 46 fruits in Year 2.
ancient-fruit.strategyNote: 28-day initial growth, 7-day regrowth, 550g base. Tested math: 1 Ancient Fruit = 46 fruits/year × 2,310g Artisan Wine = 106,260g per plant annually. Fill Greenhouse with 116 Ancient Fruit + 100 Kegs. This is the proven endgame.

pumpkin.proTip: Giant Crop candidate. Fall's best single-harvest crop at 320g. Plant 3x3 for Giant Pumpkins during Spirit's Eve season.
pumpkin.strategyNote: 13-day growth limits you to 2 harvests. Juice (720g) takes 4 Keg days—that's 180g/day vs 24.6g/day raw. Worth Kegging if you have capacity. Pickles (690g) are faster but less profit.

cranberries.proTip: Yields 2 berries per harvest. 7-day initial, 5-day regrowth. Plant Day 1 for 5 harvests = 10 cranberries per plant.
cranberries.strategyNote: 75g × 2 = 150g per harvest. Fall's Blueberry equivalent but with worse ROI due to 240g seeds. Still solid passive income. Wine is inefficient—skip it unless completionist.

sweet-gem-berry.proTip: Rare Seeds from Traveling Cart (600-1000g). 24-day growth = exactly 1 harvest per Fall. 3000g base price, cannot be processed.
sweet-gem-berry.strategyNote: 3000g raw, no Wine option. That's 125g/day—lower than Starfruit Wine but zero Keg dependency. Buy seeds whenever you see them at Traveling Cart. Give one to Old Master Cannoli for Stardrop.

red-cabbage.proTip: Seeds unlock Year 2 at Pierre's. Required for 'Dye Bundle' in Community Center. Plan ahead or pray for Traveling Cart.
red-cabbage.strategyNote: 260g base with 9-day growth. Solid mid-tier Summer crop. Juice (585g) is worthwhile if Kegs are free. Year 1 players: check Traveling Cart every Friday/Sunday for seeds.
red-cabbage.bestUse: Community Center completion, Year 2 Summer farming

hops.proTip: Fastest regrowth in game: daily harvest after 11-day initial growth. One Hops plant = 17 harvests per Summer.
hops.strategyNote: 25g raw is weak. But Pale Ale (300g, 420g Artisan) in 1-2 Keg days? That hits 150-210g/day per Hops. The catch: you need 1 Keg per Hops plant to keep up. Keg-heavy but the profit ceiling is the highest in game.
hops.bestUse: Pale Ale mass production (requires many Kegs)

corn.proTip: Grows Summer AND Fall. Plant Day 1 of Summer → harvest through Fall 28. One of two multi-season crops.
corn.strategyNote: 50g base is low, but zero replanting for 2 seasons. 14-day initial, 4-day regrowth = ~10 harvests across Summer+Fall. Oil Maker produces Corn Oil (worth 100g). Decent for lazy farmers.

caviar.proTip: Sturgeon Roe → Preserves Jar = Caviar (500g, 700g Artisan). Takes 4000 in-game minutes.
caviar.strategyNote: Sturgeon Fish Pond is the key. At max population, daily Roe production. One of the best passive income streams. Prioritize Sturgeon over other Fish Pond fish.
caviar.bestUse: Passive income via Sturgeon Fish Pond

aged-roe.proTip: Any Fish Roe except Sturgeon → Preserves Jar = Aged Roe. Value = 2× Roe price + 60g.
aged-roe.strategyNote: Lava Eel Roe is best non-Sturgeon option (700g Roe → 1460g Aged Roe with Artisan). Consider Lava Eel Pond for Magma Geodes + Aged Roe.

pale-ale.proTip: Hops + Keg = Pale Ale (300g, 420g Artisan). Only 1-2 days Keg time. Fastest turnaround in the Keg.
pale-ale.strategyNote: Hops produce daily after 11-day growth. From my setup: 17 Kegs per Hops plant keeps pace. With 100 Hops + 1700 Kegs, you hit 420g × 17 harvests = 7,140g per plant per Summer.

beer.proTip: Wheat + Keg = Beer (200g, 280g Artisan). Quick 1-2 day process.
beer.strategyNote: Wheat (25g) → Beer (200g) is 8× multiplier. Not as good as Pale Ale but Wheat is easier to mass-produce. Good secondary Keg filler.

mead.proTip: Honey + Keg = Mead (200g, 280g Artisan). 10 hour Keg time.
mead.strategyNote: Wild Honey (100g) → Mead (200g) doubles value. But Flower Honey loses value in Keg—Fairy Honey (680g) → Mead (200g). Keep flower honey raw, Keg only wild honey.
mead.bestUse: Wild Honey only—never Keg flower honey

cheese.proTip: Milk + Cheese Press = Cheese (230g). Large Milk → Gold Cheese (345g). 3.3 hour process.
cheese.strategyNote: Always process milk into cheese. 125g Milk → 230g Cheese is easy 84% profit boost. With Rancher: 150g Milk → 276g Cheese. Never sell raw milk.

goat-cheese.proTip: Goat Milk + Cheese Press = Goat Cheese (400g, 560g Artisan). Large → Gold (600g, 840g).
goat-cheese.strategyNote: Goat Cheese is Leah's loved gift. Higher value than cow cheese. Goats produce every other day vs cows daily, but per-item value compensates.

truffle-oil.proTip: Truffle + Oil Maker = Truffle Oil (1,065g, 1,491g Artisan). 6 hour process.
truffle-oil.strategyNote: 625g Truffle → 1,065g Oil = 70% gain. But with Gatherer, iridium Truffles hit 1,250g raw. I tested both: Artisan + Oil wins unless you stack Gatherer + lucky foraging days.
truffle-oil.bestUse: Artisan profession maximizes, Gatherer may prefer raw

honey.proTip: Bee House produces honey every 4 days (3 with flowers). Flower type within 5 tiles determines honey type.
honey.strategyNote: Wild Honey: 100g. Fairy Rose Honey: 680g. Plant Fairy Roses in Fall, surround with Bee Houses. Each house needs only 1 flower in range. Passive 680g every 3-4 days.

fairy-honey.proTip: Bee House + Fairy Rose (Fall flower) = 680g honey. The highest value honey.
fairy-honey.strategyNote: Fairy Rose grows in 12 days of Fall. Plant Day 1, flower Day 12. That leaves 16 days for honey production. 680g × ~5 harvests = 3,400g per Bee House in Fall.
fairy-honey.bestUse: Never Keg—sell raw for maximum value

maple-syrup.proTip: Tapper on Maple Tree = Maple Syrup (200g) every 9 days. Heavy Tapper = 4-5 days.
maple-syrup.strategyNote: Essential crafting ingredient (Bee House, Preserves Jar). Save early-game production for crafting. Late-game sell excess. One of three Tapper products.

oak-resin.proTip: Tapper on Oak Tree = Oak Resin (150g) every 7-8 days. Needed for Kegs.
oak-resin.strategyNote: Each Keg requires 1 Oak Resin. In early-game, NEVER sell Oak Resin—hoard for Keg production. 100+ Kegs = 100+ Oak Resin. Late-game only: sell excess.

pine-tar.proTip: Tapper on Pine Tree = Pine Tar (100g) every 5-6 days. Fastest Tapper product.
pine-tar.strategyNote: Used in Rain Totem and some crafting. Less critical than Oak Resin. Safe to sell excess. Lowest value Tapper product but fastest production.

coffee.proTip: 5 Coffee Beans + Keg = Coffee (150g). Only 2 hour Keg time. Gives +1 Speed buff for 1:23.
coffee.strategyNote: In my Skull Cavern runs, +1 Speed = 10% faster movement makes a huge difference. Stack with Spicy Eel (+1 more) for +2 total. Keep 50+ Coffee in stock. The buff, not the gold, is the real value.

triple-shot-espresso.proTip: 3 Coffee → Triple Shot Espresso (sold at Stardrop Saloon). +1 Speed for 4:12.
triple-shot-espresso.strategyNote: 3× duration of Coffee. Essential for Skull Cavern deep runs. Buy from Saloon or craft. The 4+ minute buff lets you clear multiple floors without re-drinking.
triple-shot-espresso.bestUse: Extended speed buff for long dungeon runs

diamond.proTip: Crystalarium produces Diamond every 5 days. Tested: 750g × 73/year = 54,750g passive income per Crystalarium.
diamond.strategyNote: Diamond Crystalarium is the standard for passive income. No Artisan bonus, but zero processing needed. In my farmhouse, 20 Crystalariums generate 1,095,000g/year hands-free. Universal loved gift too.
diamond.bestUse: Crystalarium passive income, universal loved gift

prismatic-shard.proTip: First one → Galaxy Sword (desert pillars). After that: Junimo Hut, tailoring, or donation.
prismatic-shard.strategyNote: 2000g sell is a waste. Galaxy Sword is game-changing. Extra shards: enchanting, Junimo Huts, gifting (only Haley hates). Never Crystalarium—1.75 days for 2000g is terrible.

iridium-ore.proTip: Skull Cavern floors 100+ for best rates. Statue of Perfection produces 2-8 daily.
iridium-ore.strategyNote: Iridium Bar (1000g) needs 5 ore + 1 coal. But tools, sprinklers, and crafting need bars. Never sell ore—always smelt. Statue of Perfection is 2.5+ bars/day free.

battery-pack.proTip: Lightning Rod during storms = Battery Pack. Solar Panel produces 1 per week.
battery-pack.strategyNote: 500g sell but critical for crafting (Iridium Sprinklers, Crystalariums, Iridium Bands). Hoard early-game. Late-game with Solar Panels: safe to sell excess.

lucky-lunch.proTip: Sea Cucumber + Tortilla + Blue Jazz = Lucky Lunch. +3 Luck buff.
lucky-lunch.strategyNote: +3 Luck is huge for Skull Cavern (more ladders, fewer monsters, better drops). Stack with Lucky Ring, Daily Luck, and Qi Seasoning for maximum RNG.

spicy-eel.proTip: Eel + Hot Pepper = Spicy Eel. +1 Luck, +1 Speed. Drops from Serpents in Skull Cavern.
spicy-eel.strategyNote: Best general-purpose buff food. +1 Luck + Speed in one item. Serpent drops make these farmable in Skull Cavern. Stack with Coffee/Espresso for +2 Speed total.

seafoam-pudding.proTip: Flounder + Midnight Carp + Squid Ink = Seafoam Pudding. +4 Fishing buff.
seafoam-pudding.strategyNote: +4 Fishing is massive for catching Legendaries. With Level 10 + Seafoam, you have effective Level 14. Makes Legend and other hard fish much easier. Keep 10+ for legendary attempts.

pineapple.proTip: Ginger Island exclusive. 28-day initial, 7-day regrowth. Wine = 900g (1,260g Artisan).
pineapple.strategyNote: 300g base is solid but Wine is where it shines. On Ginger Island farm: plant Pineapple, harvest weekly, Keg into Wine. Second best Wine after Starfruit/Ancient Fruit.

banana.proTip: Ginger Island tree. 28-day growth, 4-day regrowth. Wine = 450g (630g Artisan).
banana.strategyNote: 150g base, grows on trees (not farm plots). Lower priority than Pineapple for Kegging. Good for filling extra Island space. Jelly (350g) is faster if Keg-limited.

mango.proTip: Ginger Island tree. Similar to Banana but from tree saplings found on island.
mango.strategyNote: 130g base. Wine (390g) is decent but not priority. Process in Jars (310g) if low on Kegs. Tree crops require no replanting once established.
mango.bestUse: Passive tree income on Ginger Island

blue-jazz.proTip: Blue Jazz flowers are universally liked gifts. Plant them near your farmhouse for easy access when you need a quick gift.
blue-jazz.strategyNote: At 50g base price, Blue Jazz is not a profit crop. Its main value is in gifting and the Community Center Spring Crops Bundle. Honey from Blue Jazz Flowers sells for 200g.

tulip.proTip: Tulips have the fastest flower growth at 6 days. Plant them early to complete the Spring Crops Bundle.
tulip.strategyNote: Base price of 30g makes this purely a bundle/gifting crop. Tulip Honey sells for 160g - not worth the Bee House time. Complete your bundle and move on.

tomato.proTip: Tomatoes have a 5% chance to drop extra fruit per harvest. With 4-day regrowth and multi-harvest, they are Summer workhorses.
tomato.strategyNote: At 60g base with multi-harvest potential, Tomatoes are excellent passive income. Juice (180g) takes 4 days - only worthwhile with excess Kegs. Raw shipping is the meta.

hot-pepper.proTip: Hot Peppers regrow every 3 days - the fastest regrowth in the game. Plant Day 1 Summer for 9 harvests.
hot-pepper.strategyNote: 40g base seems low, but 3-day regrowth means 120g/harvest cycle after initial growth. Jelly (130g) is decent. Great for Pepper Poppers (speed buff recipe).
hot-pepper.bestUse: Fast regrowth passive income, Pepper Poppers

radish.proTip: Radishes are single-harvest with 6-day growth. They fill a gap when you need quick Summer gold.
radish.strategyNote: 90g base price is solid for a 6-day crop. Pickles (220g) take 3 days - decent ROI if you have spare Jars. Not a main crop, but useful for filling empty tiles.

wheat.proTip: Wheat is the only crop that yields both Wheat (25g) AND Hay (free animal feed). With Scythe harvest, no energy cost.
wheat.strategyNote: Never sell Wheat for gold - the value is in free Hay. One Wheat plant = one Hay = 50g saved on animal feed. Plant 100+ Wheat and never buy Hay again.

summer-spangle.proTip: Summer Spangle is a universally liked gift. The 8-day growth makes it less efficient than Blue Jazz for flower farming.
summer-spangle.strategyNote: 90g base is decent for a flower, but the real value is gifting. Summer Spangle Honey (280g) is worth making if you have spare Bee Houses.

poppy.proTip: Poppies are Penny favorite gift and required for Energy Tonic. 7-day growth, 140g base.
poppy.strategyNote: Poppy Honey sells for 380g - the highest value flower honey. If you are running Bee Houses, Poppies are the Summer meta. Plant near Bee Houses for maximum efficiency.

eggplant.proTip: Eggplant has 5% chance for extra drops. 5-day growth, then 5-day regrowth. A solid Fall workhorse.
eggplant.strategyNote: 60g base with multi-harvest potential. Plant Day 1 of Fall for 6 harvests. Pickles (170g) are decent if you have spare Jars.

amaranth.proTip: Amaranth is a single-harvest Fall crop with 7-day growth. 150g base price makes it respectable.
amaranth.strategyNote: Amaranth is solid but outclassed by Cranberries and Pumpkins. Use it to fill gaps or for the Fall Crops Bundle. Pickles (370g) are excellent if processing.

grape.proTip: Grapes grow on trellises with 3-day regrowth. 10-day initial growth, but excellent late-season production.
grape.strategyNote: 80g base with consistent regrowth. Wine (225g) takes 7 days - worthwhile for Grapes. Plant by Fall 1 for 7 harvests. Trellis placement matters!

yam.proTip: Yams have 10-day growth but 20% chance for extra drops. High variance, high potential.
yam.strategyNote: 160g base with bonus drops averages ~192g per harvest. Only 2 harvests per Fall without Speed-Gro. Solid for Pickles (390g).
yam.bestUse: High-value single harvest with bonus chance

artichoke.proTip: Artichokes unlock Year 2 at Pierres. 8-day growth, 160g base. A Year 2 Fall staple.
artichoke.strategyNote: Best single-harvest Fall crop after Pumpkin. Pickles (390g) are excellent. Plant in Year 2+ for maximum efficiency.

bok-choy.proTip: Bok Choy has the fastest Fall growth at 4 days. Quick turnover for early Fall gold.
bok-choy.strategyNote: 80g base in 4 days = solid early Fall income. 6 harvests possible per season. Pickles (210g) are decent if processing.

fairy-rose.proTip: Fairy Rose Honey sells for 680g - the highest value honey in the game. 12-day growth means plant by Fall 16.
fairy-rose.strategyNote: 290g base makes Fairy Rose profitable raw. But Fairy Rose Honey (680g, 952g Artisan) is the real prize. The Fall flower meta for Bee Houses.
fairy-rose.bestUse: Highest value Honey in the game

sunflower.proTip: Sunflowers drop 0-2 Sunflower Seeds on harvest. With luck, they can be self-sustaining.
sunflower.strategyNote: 80g base plus seed drops. Grows in Summer AND Fall - one of few dual-season crops. Sunflower Honey (260g) is mid-tier. Good for decoration and Oil production.

taro-root.proTip: Ginger Island exclusive crop. 10-day growth in any season on the island. Can be irrigated for faster growth.
taro-root.strategyNote: 100g base. The island irrigation system (-25% growth time) makes Taro more efficient. Mainly used for Taro Tuber recipe.

pufferfish.proTip: Summer only, sunny days, 12PM-4PM at the Ocean. One of the hardest fish to catch. Required for the Ocean Fish Bundle.
pufferfish.strategyNote: 200g base, but rare conditions. Use Trap Bobber or Cork Bobber. Save one for the bundle, sell extras. Not worth farming due to tight time window.

sturgeon.proTip: Found in Mountain Lake, Summer/Winter, 6AM-7PM. Difficulty 78 - bring Trap Bobber. The fish for Caviar production.
sturgeon.strategyNote: 200g base, but Fish Pond is the real play. Sturgeon Roe (320g) → Caviar (500g, 700g Artisan). In my farm, 3 Sturgeon ponds at max population net 2,100g/day with Artisan.

lava-eel.proTip: Volcano Dungeon floors 5+, any time/season. Difficulty 90 - second hardest fish. Magic Bait works in lava.
lava-eel.strategyNote: 700g base is excellent. Lava Eel Fish Pond produces Roe AND Magma Geodes. The Roe (700g) ages to 1,064g Caviar. High-tier passive income source.
lava-eel.bestUse: Fish Pond for Roe + Magma Geodes

legend.proTip: Spring only, rainy day, Mountain Lake, Fishing Level 10 required. Difficulty 110 - the hardest fish. Once per save file (except Legend II in 1.6).
legend.strategyNote: 5,000g base makes Legend the most valuable regular fish. With Angler profession, sells for 7,500g. Keep one for your collection, sell if you need spring gold.

mutant-carp.proTip: Sewers only, any season/time/weather. Requires Rusty Key from Gunther. Difficulty 80.
mutant-carp.strategyNote: 1,000g base. The easiest legendary to catch repeatedly. Good for gold farming if you have Sewer access. Angler profession makes it 1,500g.

crimsonfish.proTip: Summer only, East Pier (Beach), Fishing Level 5 required. Difficulty 95. Rainy or sunny works.
crimsonfish.strategyNote: 1,500g base. Once per save file. A solid summer gold injection. With Angler, sells for 2,250g. Pure trophy/gold fish.

angler-fish.proTip: Fall only, wooden plank bridge north of JojaMart, Fishing Level 3+. Difficulty 85. A challenging catch.
angler-fish.strategyNote: 900g base. Once per save file. Sell with Angler profession for 1,350g. Complete your legendary collection!

glacierfish.proTip: Winter only, Arrowhead Island (south tip of Forest), Fishing Level 6 required. Difficulty 100.
glacierfish.strategyNote: 1,000g base. Once per save file. The second-hardest legendary. Trap Bobber essential. Sells for 1,500g with Angler.

catfish.proTip: Spring/Fall, rainy days only, River (Town/Forest) or Secret Woods. 6AM-12AM. Difficulty 75.
catfish.strategyNote: 200g base. Weather-dependent catch. Save one for the River Fish Bundle. Good Fish Pond candidate - produces Roe.

octopus.proTip: Summer only, morning (6AM-1PM), Ocean. Difficulty 95 - one of the hardest non-legendary fish.
octopus.strategyNote: 150g base does not match the difficulty. Required for Specialty Fish Bundle. Took me 3 summers to finally land one - use Trap Bobber.

super-cucumber.proTip: Summer/Fall, evening only (6PM-2AM), Ocean. Difficulty 80. Glows in the dark!
super-cucumber.strategyNote: 250g base is solid. Required for the Night Fishing Bundle. Roe (375g) makes decent Aged Roe. A fun evening catch.

truffle.proTip: Pigs find Truffles daily in Fall (and other seasons at higher hearts). Keep pigs at max happiness for consistent finds.
truffle.strategyNote: 625g base vs Truffle Oil (1,065g). Oil takes 6 hours in Oil Maker. With Artisan: Oil = 1,491g. ALWAYS make Truffle Oil unless you need instant gold.

morel.proTip: Spring forage in Secret Woods and Forest Farm. Also spawns on Farm Cave (mushroom option).
morel.strategyNote: 150g base. Best sold raw unless you need it for Life Elixir recipe. Common Mushrooms are better for Cave farming.
morel.bestUse: Spring foraging gold, Life Elixir ingredient

chanterelle.proTip: Fall forage in Secret Woods. Golden-colored mushroom. Also from Farm Cave.
chanterelle.strategyNote: 160g base - the most valuable common forage mushroom. Sell raw for quick gold.

common-mushroom.proTip: Fall forage everywhere. Farm Cave (mushroom) produces them daily. Very common.
common-mushroom.strategyNote: 40g base. Low value but high volume from Cave. Use for Life Elixir or sell in bulk. Not worth processing.

purple-mushroom.proTip: Found in Mines floors 81-119 and Farm Cave. Rare spawn.
purple-mushroom.strategyNote: 250g base. Save for Life Elixir recipe (restores full energy/health). Rare enough to be valuable.

ruby.proTip: Found in Mines floors 80+, Omni Geodes, and gem nodes. Common gem.
ruby.strategyNote: 250g base. Crystallarium produces one every 2 days. Good passive income source, but Diamond is better.
ruby.bestUse: Crystallarium income, Spicy Eel trade (Desert Trader)

emerald.proTip: Found in Mines floors 80+, Omni Geodes. Green gem.
emerald.strategyNote: 250g base. Same Crystallarium output as Ruby. Can trade 1 Emerald for Cheese at Desert Trader on Fridays.

jade.proTip: Found in Mines floors 40+, Omni Geodes. Green gem.
jade.strategyNote: 200g base, but the meta is trading Jade for Staircases at Desert Trader on Sundays. Crystallarium Jade = infinite Staircases for Skull Cavern.

large-milk.proTip: High-heart cows produce Large Milk. Keep cows happy and petted daily.
large-milk.strategyNote: 190g base vs Gold Cheese (300g) or Iridium Cheese (400g). ALWAYS process Large Milk into Cheese - massive value increase.

large-egg.proTip: High-heart chickens lay Large Eggs. Keep chickens happy for consistent large eggs.
large-egg.strategyNote: 95g base vs Gold Mayo (285g). Large Eggs make Gold Mayo directly. Always process eggs.

duck-egg.proTip: Ducks lay eggs every 2 days at high hearts. Requires Big Coop.
duck-egg.strategyNote: 95g base vs Duck Mayonnaise (375g). Nearly 4x value increase from processing. Never sell raw.

goat-milk.proTip: Goats produce milk every 2 days. Requires Big Barn.
goat-milk.strategyNote: 225g base vs Goat Cheese (400g). Process all Goat Milk - 77% value increase.

large-goat-milk.proTip: High-heart goats produce Large Goat Milk. Requires consistent care.
large-goat-milk.strategyNote: 345g base vs Gold Goat Cheese (600g). Always process. Goat Cheese is also a loved gift for several NPCs.

wool.proTip: Sheep produce wool every 3 days. Rabbits drop wool randomly. Shepherd profession makes wool better quality.
wool.strategyNote: 340g base vs Cloth (470g). Cloth takes 4 hours in Loom. Only process if you need Cloth for crafting or Clothes.

rabbits-foot.proTip: Rabbits randomly drop Rabbits Foot. Higher hearts = higher chance. Lucky!
rabbits-foot.strategyNote: 565g base. A universally loved gift AND required for Secret Note #20 event. Keep 1-2, sell extras.

dinosaur-egg.proTip: First one: INCUBATE IT. Found in artifact spots, fishing treasure, prehistoric floors. Extremely rare first find.
dinosaur-egg.strategyNote: 350g base but DO NOT SELL YOUR FIRST ONE. Incubate to get a Dinosaur, which lays more eggs. After you have a Dino, eggs sell for 350g or make 800g Mayo.

void-egg.proTip: Void Chickens lay Void Eggs daily. Get first Void Egg from random witch event or Krobuss shop.
void-egg.strategyNote: 65g base vs Void Mayonnaise (275g). Over 4x value increase. Always process.

golden-egg.proTip: Golden Chickens lay Golden Eggs. Requires 100% perfection to unlock Golden Chicken.
golden-egg.strategyNote: 500g base vs Gold Mayonnaise (worth 750g). Endgame flex item.

ostrich-egg.proTip: Ostriches lay Ostrich Eggs every 7 days. Requires Island Barn.
ostrich-egg.strategyNote: 600g base vs 10x Mayonnaise (1,000g). Yes, one Ostrich Egg makes 10 Mayo. Always process.

milk.proTip: Regular cows produce milk daily when happy. Basic barn animal product.
milk.strategyNote: 125g base vs Cheese (230g). 84% value increase from Cheese Press. Always process milk.

egg.proTip: Chickens lay eggs daily when happy. White or brown eggs have same value.
egg.strategyNote: 50g base vs Mayonnaise (190g). Nearly 4x value. Never sell raw eggs.

mayonnaise.proTip: Made from regular eggs in Mayonnaise Machine. Takes 3 hours.
mayonnaise.strategyNote: 190g (Artisan: 266g). Basic processed animal product. Sell it - no further processing available.
mayonnaise.bestUse: Direct sale, ingredient for some recipes

duck-mayonnaise.proTip: Made from Duck Eggs. Higher value than regular Mayo.
duck-mayonnaise.strategyNote: 375g (Artisan: 525g). Solid income from Duck eggs. Sell all of it.

void-mayonnaise.proTip: Made from Void Eggs. Krobus loves it!
void-mayonnaise.strategyNote: 275g (Artisan: 385g). Krobus loved gift. Keep some for gifting, sell the rest.

dinosaur-mayonnaise.proTip: Made from Dinosaur Eggs. Highest value mayonnaise.
dinosaur-mayonnaise.strategyNote: 800g (Artisan: 1,120g). Once you have a Dino farm going, this is excellent passive income.

cloth.proTip: Made from Wool in Loom. Takes 4 hours. Also dropped by Mummies.
cloth.strategyNote: 470g base. Used in many clothing recipes and Mill Bundle. Sell extras, keep some for crafting.

sap.proTip: Gathered from trees when chopping. Maple, Oak, and Pine all drop Sap.
sap.strategyNote: 2g base - nearly worthless raw. Save 500 for Rain Totem crafting. Used in Fertilizer recipes.

hardwood.proTip: 12/day from Secret Woods stumps. Also from Mahogany Trees and Large Stumps on farm.
hardwood.strategyNote: 15g base but NEVER SELL. Used in Stable, buildings, Warp Totems, and many upgrades. Hoard all Hardwood.

wood.proTip: Chop trees daily. Plant Tree Seeds for sustainable wood farm.
wood.strategyNote: 2g base - never sell. You need 1000s for buildings, machines, and crafting. I plant 50+ trees on farm edges for steady supply.

stone.proTip: Mine rocks everywhere. Quarry provides unlimited stone once unlocked.
stone.strategyNote: 2g base - never sell. Stone goes into paths, buildings, Crystalariums. Keep 999+ in stock; I burned through 3000 building my Keg shed.

fiber.proTip: Cut weeds with Scythe. Grows back seasonally. Also from Fiber Seeds.
fiber.strategyNote: 1g base - never sell. Used in Scarecrows, Grass Starters, and Warp Totems. Keep 200+ always; you burn through it fast.

coal.proTip: Mine dust sprites (floors 41-79), Clint sells it, or Charcoal Kilns from Wood.
coal.strategyNote: 15g base but needed for every bar you smelt. Charcoal Kiln (10 Wood = 1 Coal) is slow. Farm dust sprites or buy from Clint.

copper-ore.proTip: Mine floors 1-39 primarily. Also from Geodes and panning.
copper-ore.strategyNote: 5g base - never sell. Smelt into Copper Bars for machines. Building 100 Kegs eats through 500+ Copper Bars.

iron-ore.proTip: Mine floors 41-79 primarily. Also from Frozen Geodes.
iron-ore.strategyNote: 10g base - never sell. Iron Bars power Quality Sprinklers and most mid-game machines. Stock up hard.

gold-ore.proTip: Mine floors 81-119. Also from Magma and Omni Geodes.
gold-ore.strategyNote: 25g base - never sell. Gold Bars fuel Iridium Sprinklers and late-game crafting. Save every piece.

copper-bar.proTip: Smelt 5 Copper Ore + 1 Coal. Takes 30 minutes.
copper-bar.strategyNote: 60g base - never sell. Needed for Tappers, Kegs, Bee Houses, and tool upgrades. The backbone of early crafting.

iron-bar.proTip: Smelt 5 Iron Ore + 1 Coal. Takes 2 hours.
iron-bar.strategyNote: 120g base - never sell unless excess. Quality Sprinklers, Kegs, and many machines need Iron Bars.

gold-bar.proTip: Smelt 5 Gold Ore + 1 Coal. Takes 5 hours.
gold-bar.strategyNote: 250g base - never sell. Iridium Sprinklers, Crystalariums, and late-game machines need Gold Bars.

iridium-bar.proTip: Smelt 5 Iridium Ore + 1 Coal. Ore from Skull Cavern floors 50+.
iridium-bar.strategyNote: 1,000g base - tempting to sell but hold off. Iridium tools and Crystalariums eat bars fast. Only sell if sitting on 100+ bars.

radioactive-bar.proTip: Smelt 5 Radioactive Ore + 1 Coal. Ore from Qi quest mines.
radioactive-bar.strategyNote: 3,000g base. Used in some 1.5 content. Sell if you have completed all radioactive crafting.

quartz.proTip: Found in Mines all floors. Also from Geodes.
quartz.strategyNote: 25g base. Refine into Refined Quartz (3 Quartz + 1 Coal = 3 Refined). Used in Quality Sprinklers. Keep for crafting.

fire-quartz.proTip: Found in Mines floors 80+. Red glowing mineral.
fire-quartz.strategyNote: 100g base. Refines into 3 Refined Quartz. Good donation for Museum. Sell extras.

frozen-tear.proTip: Found in Mines floors 41-79 and Frozen Geodes. Sebastian loves these.
frozen-tear.strategyNote: 75g base. Sebastian loved gift - keep some for him. Also used in Warrior Ring recipe.

earth-crystal.proTip: Found in Mines floors 1-39 and Geodes. Brown crystal.
earth-crystal.strategyNote: 50g base. Used in Mayonnaise Machine recipe. Keep some for crafting early game.

amethyst.proTip: Found in Mines floors 1-39 and Geodes. Abigail loves these.
amethyst.strategyNote: 100g base. Abigail loves Amethyst - great early gift. Crystallarium produces 1.5/day.

aquamarine.proTip: Found in Mines floors 41+ and Frozen Geodes. Blue gem.
aquamarine.strategyNote: 180g base. Decent Crystallarium value. Also used in Marble Brazier recipe.

topaz.proTip: Found in Mines all floors and Geodes. Yellow gem.
topaz.strategyNote: 80g base. Low Crystallarium value compared to Diamond or Jade. Sell or gift.

spring-onion.proTip: Found in Forest (south of Farm) Spring only. Respawns daily.
spring-onion.strategyNote: 8g base - not worth selling. But free energy in early game. Just eat them while foraging.

daffodil.proTip: Spring forage everywhere. One of the first items you find.
daffodil.strategyNote: 30g base. Universally liked gift (not loved). Good for early friendship building.

leek.proTip: Spring forage in Mountains and Forest. George loves Leeks.
leek.strategyNote: 60g base. George loved gift - easy early friendship with him. Also used in some cooking.

dandelion.strategyNote: 40g base. Universally liked. Good for salads recipe. Low priority forage.

wild-horseradish.proTip: Spring forage in Forest and Secret Woods.
wild-horseradish.strategyNote: 50g base. Required for Spring Foraging Bundle. Save 1 for bundle, sell rest.

salmonberry.proTip: Salmonberry Season: Spring 15-18. Bushes produce unlimited berries. Gather hundreds!
salmonberry.strategyNote: 5g base - terrible sell price. But FREE ENERGY. Gather 200+ and eat them all Spring/Summer for energy.

spice-berry.proTip: Summer forage in Forest and Beach.
spice-berry.strategyNote: 80g base - decent summer forage. Required for Summer Foraging Bundle.

grape-forage.proTip: Summer forage in Mountains. Purple grapes.
grape-forage.strategyNote: 80g base. Vincent loves grapes. Good summer forage value.

sweet-pea.proTip: Summer forage in Bus Stop and Forest.
sweet-pea.strategyNote: 50g base. Universally liked flower. Good for Summer Foraging Bundle.

fiddlehead-fern.proTip: Summer forage ONLY in Secret Woods. Required for Fiddlehead Risotto.
fiddlehead-fern.strategyNote: 90g base. Only spawns in Secret Woods. Save for Chef Bundle and Fiddlehead Risotto recipe. Do not waste on raw selling.

red-mushroom.proTip: Summer/Fall forage in Secret Woods and Mines. Also Farm Cave.
red-mushroom.strategyNote: 75g base. Used in Life Elixir recipe. Mildly poisonous if eaten raw (-stamina).

wild-plum.strategyNote: 80g base. Required for Fall Foraging Bundle. Jelly (210g) is decent if processing.

hazelnut.proTip: Fall forage everywhere. Spawns on ground and bushes.
hazelnut.strategyNote: 90g base. Required for Fall Foraging Bundle. Decent forage value.

blackberry.proTip: Blackberry Season: Fall 8-11. Bushes produce unlimited berries.
blackberry.strategyNote: 20g base - low value but FREE. Gather hundreds for free energy and Jelly (90g).

holly.strategyNote: 80g base. Universally hated gift - it is poisonous. Sell only, never gift.

crystal-fruit.proTip: Winter forage in all outdoor areas. Blue crystal fruit.
crystal-fruit.strategyNote: 150g base - highest winter forage value. Wine (337g) is worth making.

snow-yam.proTip: Winter forage - dig up with Hoe in tillable ground. Also from artifact spots.
snow-yam.strategyNote: 100g base. Required for Winter Foraging Bundle. Decent digging income.

winter-root.proTip: Winter forage - dig up with Hoe. Also dropped by Blue Slimes.
winter-root.strategyNote: 70g base. Required for Winter Foraging Bundle. Common winter find.

crocus.strategyNote: 60g base. Sandy loves Crocus. Keep some for gifting to Sandy.

nautilus-shell.proTip: Winter forage on Beach. Brown spiral shell.
nautilus-shell.strategyNote: 120g base. Required for Winter Foraging Bundle. Also used in some crafting.

rainbow-shell.proTip: Summer forage on Beach. Rare rainbow-colored shell.
rainbow-shell.strategyNote: 300g base - highest beach forage. Keep 1 for potential quests, sell extras.

coconut.proTip: Found in Desert by hitting palm trees. Also from Oasis shop.
coconut.strategyNote: 100g base. Used in many tropical recipes. Stock up when in Desert.

cactus-fruit.proTip: Desert forage and from Cactus planted in greenhouse. Sam loves these.
cactus-fruit.strategyNote: 75g base. Sam loved gift. Plant Cactus in Greenhouse for year-round production.

ginger.proTip: Ginger Island forage. Dig up from artifact spots on island.
ginger.strategyNote: 60g base. Used in many 1.5 recipes and Ginger Ale (energy drink). Keep stock for recipes.

magma-cap.proTip: Volcano Dungeon forage. Red glowing mushroom.
magma-cap.strategyNote: 400g base - highest value forage mushroom. Sell raw for excellent gold.

refined-quartz.proTip: Made in Furnace (1 Quartz or Fire Quartz + 1 Coal) or Recycling Machine from Broken CD/Glasses.
refined-quartz.strategyNote: 50g base - never sell. Critical for Quality Sprinklers, Lightning Rods, and crafting machines.

oil.proTip: Made in Oil Maker from Corn, Sunflower Seeds, or Sunflowers.
oil.strategyNote: 100g base. Used in many cooking recipes. Make from Corn or buy from Pierre for 200g.

sugar.proTip: Buy from Pierre (100g) or make in Mill from Beets.
sugar.strategyNote: 100g if sold - but do not sell. Used in most baking recipes. Keep stock of 20+ for cooking.

wheat-flour.proTip: Buy from Pierre (100g) or make in Mill from Wheat.
wheat-flour.strategyNote: 100g if sold - but do not sell. Used in most cooking recipes. Mill your Wheat to save gold.

rice.proTip: Buy from Pierre (200g) or mill from Unmilled Rice (grown crop).
rice.strategyNote: Used in many recipes including Maki Roll. Mill your own to save gold.

vinegar.proTip: Buy from Pierre for 200g. Cannot be crafted.
vinegar.strategyNote: Used in Pickles recipe and some other cooking. Buy as needed.

geode.proTip: Found in Mines floors 1-39. Break open at Clints for 25g.
geode.strategyNote: Contains minerals and artifacts. Process all of them at Clint for Museum donations and gems.

frozen-geode.proTip: Found in Mines floors 41-79. Blue geode.
frozen-geode.strategyNote: Contains ice-themed minerals. Process all for Museum and Frozen Tears.

magma-geode.proTip: Found in Mines floors 81-119 and Volcano. Red geode.
magma-geode.strategyNote: Contains fire-themed minerals and Fire Quartz. Best regular geode for value.

omni-geode.proTip: Found everywhere, especially Skull Cavern. Can contain any mineral.
omni-geode.strategyNote: Best geode type - can drop any mineral including Prismatic Shard. Process all at Clint.

golden-pumpkin.proTip: Win at Spirit Eve maze (Fall 27). One per year.
golden-pumpkin.strategyNote: 2,500g base. Universal loved gift. Best uses: gift to hard-to-please NPCs or sell for gold.

pearl.proTip: Rare from Night Market Mermaid show or Blobfish Fish Pond.
pearl.strategyNote: 2,500g base. Universal loved gift. Very rare. Save for difficult gift situations.

strange-bun.proTip: Cook from Wheat Flour (1) + Periwinkle (1) + Void Mayonnaise (1). Recipe from Shane 7 hearts.
strange-bun.strategyNote: Gives Mining +1 buff. Strange recipe but useful buff. Shane loves it.

fried-egg.proTip: Cook from Egg (1). First recipe you learn.
fried-egg.strategyNote: 35g sale price. +50 Energy, +22 Health. Early game energy food. Quick to make.

crab-cakes.proTip: Cook from Crab (1) + Wheat Flour (1) + Egg (1) + Oil (1). Recipe from Gus for 500g.
crab-cakes.strategyNote: 275g sale price. +Speed +1 buff. One of few foods with Speed buff. Excellent for mobility.

dish-o-the-sea.proTip: Cook from Sardine (2) + Hashbrowns (1). Recipe from Fishing Level 3.
dish-o-the-sea.strategyNote: 220g sale price. +Fishing +3 buff. Best early-game fishing buff food. Make before Legend attempts.

pumpkin-pie.proTip: Cook from Pumpkin (1) + Wheat Flour (1) + Milk (1) + Sugar (1). Recipe from Queen of Sauce.
pumpkin-pie.strategyNote: 385g sale price. Universally liked gift. Solid energy food (+225 Energy).

qi-fruit.proTip: Grows from Qi Beans during Mr. Qi quests. 4-day growth.
qi-fruit.strategyNote: 1g sale price (worthless). Used only during Qi quests. Process into wine for quest completion.
